node.title: Floodwaters spill into Forbes with river expected to peak today
node.description: Water is slowly creeping into streets and properties in the central west of New South Wales this morning as the Lachlan River continues to rise.
node.content:
["Water is slowly creeping into\u00a0streets and properties\u00a0in the central west of New South Wales\u00a0this morning as the Lachlan River continues to rise.", "More than 2,000 people living in and around Forbes were ordered to evacuate yesterday\u00a0ahead of an expected river peak\u00a0today.\u00a0", "The Lachlan River has reached 10.35m, but\u00a0is set to climb to 10.65m later today, similar to the disastrous event experienced in 2016.", "Some residents were determined to stay.", "But the State Emergency Service\u00a0has praised those who have left their properties and cooperated with volunteers.", "", "
A tractor negotiates flooded roads near Forbes.(ABC Central West: Xanthe Gregory)
", "\"Generally everybody's pretty good,\" incident controller Barry Griffiths said.", "\"I think every flood event you're going to have people that are angry and upset about the situation but they're generally in the few.", "", "
Floodwaters near a house in Forbes this morning.(ABC Central West: Xanthe Gregory)
", "\"The volunteers around town have been met with a smile for the most part.\"", "
Students sent to safety
", "Hundreds of high school students have been evacuated from the Red Bend Catholic College, which sits on the edge of the Lachlan River, ahead of the flood peak.\u00a0", "", "
Principal Stephen Dwyer says the local Catholic high school has been evacuated in preparation for today's major flood peak.\u00a0(ABC Central West: Xanthe Gregory)
", "Principal Stephen Dwyer said the school had\u00a0been shut to ensure every student remained\u00a0safe.\u00a0", "\"We've had to look at detailed history of the past and the knowledge of what we need to do to prepare for this event,\" Mr Dwyer said.\u00a0", "After almost an entire year of online learning, 140 boarders and hundreds of day students are back to distance education from home,\u00a0or with friends in the region.\u00a0", "\"We're sort of used to floods out here, it's one of the events,\" he said.\u00a0", "Year 12 students who are in the middle of their Higher School Certificate exams will sit them in an alternative venue in the town's CBD.\u00a0", "\"We're bound on three sides by the Lachlan River so it's a matter of making sure everything's secure, everyone's safe.\"\u00a0"]
